children.label: Biological Collection
children.definition: Biological sample collection

children.label: Geological Collection
children.definition: Geological sample collection

children.label: Paleontological Collection
children.definition: Paleontological sample collection

children.label: Water Collection
children.definition: Water sample collection

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Mixed taxa stored in the same vial, jar, unit tray, slide, etc. Annelid slides made from same collection are in different boxes.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Specimens crowded. Species sharing trays, or taxa scattered in two or more places. Arrangement is only at a higher taxonomic level. More than one annelid sample for collection site is stored in the same box.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Specimens arranged alphabetically by family, genus, and species, or, if arranged phylogenetically, with an alphabetical cross-referenced list. Annelid slides arranged in boxes according to collection event and/or locality.

children.label: Level_4
children.definition: Specimens arranged geographically within a taxon, or arranged numerically by catalog number if specimens have been databased.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Level 1 is not defined.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: No computerization at all.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: All [herbarium, mollusk, and vertebrate] specimens databased. Taxonomic information of other groups electronically inventoried, but specimens themselves not yet databased and assigned catalog numbers.

children.label: Level_4
children.definition: All localities geo-referenced and stored electronically. Invertebrates databased at the level of storage unit (pin, vial, jar, slide).

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Labels are faded to illegible, crumbling, or missing. Labels have become detached from the specimen.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Labels are partially faded, laser-printed in fluid or in pencil, or on non-archival paper

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Labels are readily legible, printed with non-bleeding (if in fluid) archival paper and ink.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Shells have Byne’s disease. Specimens (of any kind) have signs of pest infestation. Insect specimens have fallen off of pin. Specimens are damaged to the point of being unusable

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Specimens are damaged: broken into multiple pieces, with past pest damage, loose teeth or bones. Insect pins are broken or significantly bent.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: All specimens are intact and stable.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Fluid level is low, but completely covers specimens. Alcohol is dark

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Fluid is topped-off and relatively clear

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Slide or cover slip is broken. Mounting medium is crystallized, running, or has receded up to specimen.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Aqueous mounting medium is not sealed (ringed) under cover slip. Mounting medium has receded. Cover slip or slide is cracked.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Slide in good condition. Mounted in Canada balsam or cover slip has been sealed (ringed).

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Specimens in old cardboard boxes, cigar boxes, pill boxes, or paper bags. Specimens not stored in unit trays. Plants mounted on cardboard with rubber cement

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Specimens stored in new cardboard boxes or zip-lock bags. Vertebrate trays are unlined. Skulls or skeletal material are in substandard containers. Insects pinned in hard-bottom unit trays. Plants pressed in newspaper. Fungi kept in packets when they should be in boxes, or glued to paper in the packets.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Unit trays are archival. Insects pinned in foam-bottom trays. Vertebrate trays are lined with acid-free paper. Plants and fungi are in/on acid paper/packet/box withElmer’s or other non-archival glue, or lacking fragment folders.

children.label: Level_4
children.definition: Plants and fungi in/on acid free paper/packet/box, fixed with acid free glue, and with fragment folders present.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Vial stoppers are cracked, broken, swollen, or disintegrating. Stoppers are made of cork. Vials are loose on shelf, or banded together, and not in vial rack. Jar lids are old and rusted (if metal), or are BakeliteH lids (which crack easily). Jar seals are missing, cracked, or shrinking. Five-gallon buckets have poor seals or loose lids.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Hardened but intact vial stoppers. Vials aligned in wire-sided racks. Jar lids are metal or with non-polyethylene jar seals. Large specimens are stored in 5-gallon buckets.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Vials have good quality stoppers. Vial racks are solid with no risk of vial loss. Jars are bail-topped with polyethylene gaskets, or have polypropylene lids. Large specimens are stored in archival barrels with clamping sealing mechanisms.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Slides not in slide box or tray. Slide box broken.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Slide box not standard 100-slide box. Slides in trays are not protected by envelope or thick labels, which prevent the crushing of the cover slip on one slide by the adjoining slide.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Good slide boxes or trays with rust-free hinges and substantial closure clasps.

children.label: Level_4
children.definition: Tray slides stored flat.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Data are in codes or missing entirely.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Some data are missing but can be inferred. Specimen containers (vials, jars, or slides) lack determination labels.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: All data fields are complete for all groups except pinned insects may have determination labels missing.

children.label: Level_4
children.definition: Localities fully geo-referenced. All species-level insect pins have determination labels.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: All specimens undetermined and major groups mixed.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Specimens determined to order or family (depending of the size of the group). Not all annelid slides in a slide box fully determined. All other groups determined to the family or genus level.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Specimens determined to the genus or family level. All other groups determined to species.

children.label: Level_4
children.definition: Specimens determined to the species level. All other groups determined to species or (often) subspecies and verified by a specialist.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Bulk insect specimens papered, or in jars, boxes, or cotton. Unsorted botanical specimens in newspaper or paper bags (backlog).

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Insect specimens pinned, but improperly mounted on pin or point. Mollusk and vertebrate samples not cleaned, cataloged, or numbered. Botanical material mounted to herbarium sheets with labels, but without accession numbers.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Insects properly pinned, pointed, or enveloped. Vertebrate and mollusk specimens cleaned, cataloged and numbered. Herbarium sheets in folders with all labels and accession numbers.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: Specimens stored in bulk and unprocessed. Unsorted samples stored in Whirlpac bags, Nalgene or other bottles, jars, or in the freezer.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Mixed field sample, rinsed, stored in clean alcohol, in standard quality storage containers.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Vertebrate samples sorted and tagged. Mollusk shells and soft body tissue separated. Insect specimens stored in proper vials with cotton and micro-vials, if necessary.

children.label: Level_1
children.definition: As soon as specimens are slide-mounted they are already semi-processed, so there is no Level 1.

children.label: Level_2
children.definition: Specimens were not cleared prior to mounting, or were improperly oriented on slide.

children.label: Level_3
children.definition: Specimens properly cleared and oriented on slide.
